III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A staff member insulted and cursed at a West Campus youth. On
7/6/25 around 6:33 PM, youth and another staff member headed
to the east basketball courts on bikes. When arriving, youth rode
up to a male staff and whispered, “you a bitch ass nigga." The
staff replied calling youth a "bitch ass nigga." The two exchanged
words while staff attempted to deescalate the situation. Youth
reports this adult also called youth a "hoe", "stupid ass little boy",
and "Biggie Smalls." Youth does not know the staff’s name but
was able to describe the staff’s physical appearance. Youth
reports they started "beefing" approximately two weeks ago but is
unable to identify a date or other identifying factors. Youth states
the alleged adult told youth to "get the fuck out of here" in
response to youth and a peer client potentially requiring
redirection on the basketball courts. Youth reports that the staff
stated those words first, and youth responded with calling staff a
"bitch" and other insults.
Investigation Interviews:
Therapist was interviewed via phone on July 22, 2025.
Therapist reported he had no additional information besides what
was provided in the allegations. He reported Youth A directly
reported these concerns to him.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on July
8, 2025, and July 14, 2025. Supervisor reported she was made
aware of these allegations by Youth A. She reported Staff 2 also
came to her with these concerns. Supervisor reported Youth A
reported to her Staff 1 called him a “bitch ass nigga” after Youth A
had called Staff 1 these names first. She reported Staff 2
confirmed hearing this. Supervisor reported due to these alleged
allegations, Staff 1 was placed on leave pending this investigation.
She reported Youth A does have a history of aggression and does
not do well with male staff. Supervisor reported even if Youth A
was physically or verbally aggressive toward Staff 1, Staff 1
should have never responded to Youth A with inappropriate
language.
2

Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 14,
2025. Youth A reported he likes living at the facility and does not
want to ever go to another facility. When asked why he liked it
there, Youth A reported he gets to go on outings and the staff are
very nice. Youth A reported he had a hard day on July 6, 2025.
When asked what happened, Youth A reported he was struggling
and was not kind to Staff 1. He reported on July 6, 2025, he was
riding bikes with Staff 2, and they went near the basketball court
on the other side of the facility. He reported he saw Staff 1 and
tried to joke around with him. Youth A reported he called Staff 1 a
“bitch” and Staff 1 responded by calling Youth A, a “bitch”. He
stated this was not in a mean way, it was just them joking around
because he does that with Staff 1. Youth A denied Staff 1 calling
him any other inappropriate names or swearing around him. When
asked about what he said to Therapist and Supervisor, he
reported he just said those things because he did not want to get
in trouble. Youth A then went on to talk about how he does not
want Staff 1 to get fired and does not want to move from this
facility. This consultant reassured Youth A they do not have
anything to do with Youth A’s placement or Staff 1’s employment.
Consultant explained to Youth A it is their responsibility to ensure
Youth A is treated well at the facility, and Youth A confirmed he
was being treated well.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 14,
2025. Staff 1 reported Youth A has a negative history with him. He
reported last month he picked up a shift on the unit that Youth A
lives on. Staff 1 reported Youth A became upset because Staff 1
was talking with the female staff, and Youth A has a crush on the
female staff. He reported Youth A refused to talk with him at that
time. Staff 1 reported one time he saw Youth A walking around
and told him he had a nice shirt, and Youth A responded by
stating, “Don’t fucking talk about my shirt, I am fat.” He reported
he did not respond to him. Staff 1 reported about three weeks ago,
he was working at Youth A’s unit, and Youth A came up to him
and shoulder-checked him for no reason. He reported he verbally
redirected Youth A for doing that. Staff 1 reported about a couple
of weeks later, Youth A was riding his bike with Staff 4. When
Youth A saw Staff 1, he stuck up his middle finger at him. Staff 1
reported he told Staff 4 what happened and for her to redirect
Youth A. He reported on July 6, 2025, that Youth A was outside
his unit with Staff 2. Staff 1 reported Youth A had made eye
contact with him across the facility because Staff 1 was at the
basketball court with Youth C. He reported Youth A rode his bike
up to Staff 1 with Staff 2 following behind him. Youth A came up to
3

Staff 1 and told him he was a “bitch ass nigga.” Staff 1 reported he
told Youth A, “I am not a bitch ass nigga, and you cannot say that
to me.” He reported Youth A then got more escalated and
attempted to do property damage and assault other staff. Staff 1
reported he did step away and tried to apologize to Youth A for
making him upset. When asked why he used the words “bitch ass
nigga” to Youth A, he reported Youth A has autism and he needs
to be told directly what he cannot say. This consultant asked Staff
1 if he was trained to have this response, and he stated no, he
was not. Staff 1 reported he worked with Youth A at his unit but
was never trained to work with them specifically. He reported he is
unaware of any safety plans for the youth at that program or how
the program is run. Staff 1 reported he does not understand why
the youth in that program do not receive consequences like the
youth at the other programs at parts of the overall facility. He
reported he never called Youth A “bitch ass nigga” or any other
names mentioned in the allegations. Staff 1 reported he only said
those words to redirect Youth A to make sure he knows he cannot
say those things. Staff 1 denied ever reporting the negative
interactions he had with Youth A before this incident to any
leadership team members or Youth A’s therapist.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 14,
2025. Staff 2 reported on July 6, 2025, she was supervising Youth
A outside. She reported during that time, Youth A was in a good
head space, so she chose to take him for a bike ride around the
facility. Staff 2 reported Youth A and she rode their bikes near
Staff 1, who was playing basketball. She reported Youth A rode
towards Staff 1 and called him “pussy ass bitch”. Staff 2 reported
Staff 1 attempted to redirect him, and she reported she heard Staff
1 repeat “pussy ass bitch” back to Youth A. She reported that from
what she heard, it was Staff 1 who was clarifying what Youth A
had called him and not him calling Youth A those names. Staff 2
reported she does not remember what happened afterwards
because she was focused on keeping Youth A calm. She reported
Youth A became increasingly aggressive and physically
aggressive towards others. Staff 2 reported when Youth A was still
escalating, Staff 1 did say he was sorry to Youth A for making him
upset. She does not remember exactly what Staff 1 said in his
apology, as she was trying to redirect Youth A from throwing rocks
at the parked cars. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 should have stepped
away from the situation with Youth A earlier and should not have
repeated the swear words back at Youth A.
4

Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 14,
2025. Staff 3 reported on July 6, 2025, he was out playing
basketball with Youth B. He reported Staff 1 was also out on the
basketball court with Youth C playing basketball. Staff 3 reported
when Youth A rode on his bike towards Staff 1, he was sitting on
the bench, and Staff 1 was playing basketball. He reported he
heard Youth A say something to Staff 1 when he approached but
does not remember exactly what Youth A said or what Staff 1’s
response was. Staff 3 reported he does remember Staff 2 trying to
verbally de-escalate Youth A. He reported Youth A ran over to
where the employee cars are parked and started to throw rocks.
Youth A then became physically aggressive towards staff, and
Staff 3 assisted Staff 1 and Staff 2 with restraint. Staff 3 reported
he never heard Staff 1 or any other staff at the facility call Youth A
or any other youth an inappropriate name or swear in front of
them. When asked if the situation could have been handled
differently, Staff 3 reported Staff 1 and Youth A could have been
separated more quickly but noted everyone involved did the best
they could. He does not remember hearing any inappropriate
language being said.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 14,
2025. Staff 4 reported on July 6, 2025, she was outside near the
basketball courts. She reported she saw Youth A ride his bike
towards the basketball court and stopped to talk with Staff 1. Staff
4 reported Youth A told Staff 1 he is a “bitch ass nigga.” She
reported Staff 1 responded by asking Youth A if he indeed called
him a “bitch ass nigga” which Youth A then began to escalate in
behaviors. Staff 4 reported she does not remember what else was
said after this because she was trying to verbally de-escalate
Youth A with Staff 2. She reported Staff 1 should never have
repeated what Youth A said and should have walked away from
the situation. Staff 4 reported Youth A continued to get escalated
and went toward the car to throw rocks at it. She reported Youth A
then became physically aggressive towards her and Staff 2, which
led to Youth A being restrained due to his physical aggression
towards staff. Staff 4 reported when they were by the parked cars,
Staff 1 was standing away, apologizing to Youth A, stating he was
sorry for making him upset and was trying to calm him down. She
reported Youth A does not get along with Staff 1 because he is a
male staff member. Staff 4 reported one day she was riding bikes
with Youth A around campus, and they saw Staff 1. She reported
she had to verbally redirect Youth A because he was giving Staff 1
the middle finger for no reason.
5

Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 14,
2025. Youth B reported on July 6, 2025, he was playing basketball
with Staff 1 and Staff 3. He reported Youth A came riding on his
bicycle toward the court and started “talking crazy” to Staff 1.
When asked to explain “talking crazy”, Youth B reported Youth A
was calling Staff 1 a bunch of inappropriate names but could not
remember exactly what was said. He reported it appeared to him
that Staff 1 and Youth A were joking around. Youth B denied ever
hearing Staff 1 swear or call Youth A any names. He reported he
has never heard any staff at the facility call a youth an
inappropriate name or swear at them.
Youth C was attempted to be interviewed face to face at the
facility on July 14, 2025, but was deemed AWOL from his
home visit.
Documents Received
- Email from Foster Care Worker dated 07/09/2025- Foster
Care Worker is Youth A’s assigned worker and was
informed of these allegations. She reported Youth A has
had many issues at the facility including assaults, cursing,
sexually driven comments towards staff and concerns of
AWOL. Foster Care Worker reported Youth A has some
stories that have been proven false and even with proof,
Youth A will always stick to his story.
- Human Resource File for Staff 1- Staff 1 is employed for
the overall Wedgwood Organization but is specifically
assigned to East Campus License. He has one disciplinary
action noted in his HR file. Staff 1 was provided a last
chance agreement form on 01/29/2025 due to being heard
saying “f—k you” to a female youth at the facility when that
youth was behaviorally escalated. Staff 1 took responsibility
for this incident and completed additional training and
coaching from supervision. Staff 1 has all required trainings
to work at the facility but does not have any specific training
to note to work under West Campus license to have the
understanding of the program. Staff 1 did complete the
facility’s general residential training in April 2024 which
reviews the policies of appropriate communication with the
youth.
- Facility Employee Handbook- The handbook notes,
“Each client must be recognized and treated as a unique
6

individual created by God. Employees’ interactions with
persons served must: reflect the client needs, choices,
preferences, and individuality; meet the highest
professional, ethical, and legal standards.” The handbook
goes on to state, “Employee’s responses/involvement with
a client should always reflect what is therapeutic and
appropriate. In general: Every client must be treated with
dignity and respect.”
Analysis The facility was found in violation as Staff 1 was not following the
employee handbook that notes all staff that are employed at
Wedgwood must treat every client with dignity and respect and all
interactions with persons served must meet the highest
professional, ethical, and legal standards. Even if Staff 1 was
repeating back the inappropriate name back to Youth A that is still
not a professional response to have back to a youth.
Technical Assistance:
Technical assistance was offered to make sure staff are crossed
trained within the different license programs at Wedgwood if they
are to pick up a shift. This should be documented within that
staff’s training record they were trained to work within the specific
license.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
